title: Kiper's latest NFL mock draft: Projecting the entire first round ahead of the combine
content: As the NFL gets ready for this week's combine workouts, let's project where the best players in the 2026 draft class will get picked in April.

title: Falcons GM: QB Cousins to be released March 11
content: New Falcons GM Ian Cunningham has informed QB Kirk Cousins that the team will release him on March 11, the first day of the league year, Cunningham said Tuesday on 92.9 The Game.

title: Sale signs 1-year, $27M extension with Braves
content: Chris Sale and the Braves are in agreement on a one-year, $27 million contract extension for 2027 that includes a club option for 2028.

title: Eagles' Sirianni 'can't guarantee' Brown's return
content: Philadelphia Eagles coach Nick Sirianni says there is mutual interest between the team and wide receiver A.J. Brown, but doesn't commit to him playing this year.

title: Lions will head to Munich for international game
content: For the first time since 2015, the Lions will play an international game, this time in Munich, Germany, with their opponent and date to be named later.

title: QB Rivers follows in dad Philip's path to NC State
content: Four-star quarterback Gunner Rivers, son of NC State legend and eight-time NFL Pro Bowler Philip Rivers, has committed to the Wolfpack.

title: UFL making changes on field goal points, punts
content: For its 2026 season, which starts March 27, the UFL will award four points for field goals of at least 60 yards, and ban most punts inside of the opponent's 50.

title: Grand jury doesn't indict Beverley in assault case
content: A grand jury returned a no-bill in the case involving former NBA guard Patrick Beverley, who was arrested last fall in what police called a "family violence" incident.

title: U.S. women's hockey team declines Trump invite
content: The U.S. women's hockey Olympic gold medal-winning team has politely declined an invitation from President Donald Trump to attend his State of the Union address.

content: In a time of transition for USA basketball, here's what the 12-man squad that will go up against a competitive international slate could look like.

content: Coaches and other observers see a growing need to protect athletes by regulating middlemen in NIL deals.

content: The projected No. 1 NBA draft pick has sat out enough time to cast uncertainty on his team's potential in March.

content: Wednesday's clash isn't just a chance for Jos√© Mourinho's Benfica to eliminate Real Madrid from the Champions League. It might also be an audition.

title: MLS Power Rankings: LAFC lead the way after win over champs Miami and Lionel Messi
content: LAFC get a convincing win over defending champions Inter Miami to kick off the 2026 MLS season and the latest ESPN Power Rankings.

content: While the 2026 roster returns home with medals, here's who could represent the U.S. in the French Alps Games.

content: In 2019, Hughes and Liu wrote to their retired selves. In 2026, they added Olympic gold to the story.

content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Fantasy hockey pickups: Why Dostal, Laferriere are post-Olympics must-adds
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: Bihar Opposition lobs ‚Äògun and bullets sarkar‚Äô jibe; CM Nitish loses cool, errs in speech
content: The Opposition members stage a protest in the Assembly over a baton charge against watchmen who staged a protest demanding a pay hike. As they shout, ‚Äòthe gun and bullets government will not be allowed to run‚Äô, taunting them, the Chief Minister says the NDA has 2002 members in the Assembly

title: Now khata changes for farmlands in Karnataka can be done through mobiles
content: The auto mutation system launched by the Revenue Department provides for farmers to apply for change in khatas through online method

title: Lab reports on Rajamahendravaram milk adulteration case expected this week, says official
content: Investigation points to the contamination of milk with ethylene glycol, which is used as a coolant during the milk chilling process, says Health and Family Welfare Commissioner

title: Bihar meat restrictions are about ‚Äòcultural control‚Äô: Congress MP Manickam Tagore
content: RSS, BJP trying to control what people eat, how they live, whose culture is considered ‚Äòacceptable‚Äô, he says; restrictions citing ‚Äúsocial harmony‚Äù disproportionately hurt OBCs, Dalits, Adivasis, and minorities

title: Centre increases MSP for jute; farmers in West Bengal, Assam to benefit
content: The decision will not only boost jute production and quality, but will also increase the income of farmers, says Modi

title: A.P. Cabinet clears ‚Çπ2,388-crore semiconductor facility at Tarluvada
content: 601.4 acres will be allotted for 1,000 MW AI data centre cluster project in Visakhapatnam and Anakapalli districts through three Special Purpose Vehicles

title: National meet on Cashew at KAU on February 25-26
content: Experts to discuss technology, productivity and value addition for global competitiveness in cashew sector

title: Farmers allege irregularities in land acquisition for Nellore airport
content: They claim that few officials accepted bribes from 15 persons in Damavaram village to include them in the list of perpetual leaseholders

title: Chembai Ekadasi Music Festival begins
content: The festival, which has celebrated the rich heritage of Indian classical music since 1914, features a diverse lineup of performances by Mathangi Satyamoorthy, Sukumari Narendra Menon,Vellinezhi Subramanian, Sukumari Narendra Menon, among others.

title: BJP turns to influential Christian faces in central Travancore for Assembly poll
content: Party is banking on the possibility of a swing in Catholic voting patterns. The strategy now being rolled out involves fielding prominent Christian faces in key Christian-dominated constituencies across the region

title: Malabar Cancer Centre‚Äôs ‚ÄôAI for oncology‚Äô initiative earns national recognition at India AI Summit 2026
content: The project is designed to rapidly analyse patient treatment data and support clinicians in making precise, evidence-based decisions

title: Collector takes serious note of maternal deaths in Chittoor
content: Directs medical and paramedical staff to ensure every cadre of the medical and health department strictly adheres to assigned responsibilities and continuously monitors pregnant women from conception to institutional delivery

title: Job aspirants put up a massive protest in Dharwad
content: High drama as protestors gherao police personnel and also shout ‚ÄòGo Back‚Äô slogans against the Opposition BJP leaders

title: CAG finds lapses in Jal Jeevan Mission implementation in Kerala
content: CAG report reveals significant lapses in Kerala‚Äôs Jal Jeevan Mission implementation, highlighting target shortfalls and geo-tagging errors.

title: 20 crore Tirumala laddus made with adulterated ghee, Naidu tells Assembly
content: Citing the findings of a CBI-supervised SIT, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu says that between 2019 and 2024 about 59.71 lakh litres of adulterated ghee was used, involving irregularities worth ‚Çπ231.51 crore; Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan terms it a premeditated act to defile the prasadam

title: Heritage Foods ensures product quality and empowers farmers, says Bhuvaneswari
content: Every product undergoes 25 quality tests across five critical checkpoints, says Heritage Foods vice-chairperson and managing director¬†

title: Koppal, Bhagyanagar observe bandh seeking closure of polluting industries
content: Shops and commercial establishments remain closed in response to the bandh call, while residents in affected villages extended their support

title: TTD initiates a 15-day scrap clearance drive
content: TTD Additional EO asks officials to prepare a structured disposal schedule, mandating scrap clearance once every six months

title: BJP Yuva Morcha gives memorandum to Governor on Gulbarga University irregularities
content: Delegation seeks his intervention to address the university‚Äôs administrative and financial irregularities

title: Uthralikkavu Pooram dazzles with elephants, melam and vibrant rituals
content: Massive crowds gather in post-harvest paddy fields as Enkakkad, Kumaranellur and Wadakkanchery desams bring alive centuries-old traditions

title: Northeast CMs condemn ‚Äòracial abuse‚Äô of Arunachal Pradesh women in Delhi
content: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu says such behaviour is unacceptable and has no place in society

title: Protest planned in Hubballi, Bagalkot tomorrow
content: Various organisations have decided to take part in it condemning the stone-throwing incident during a Shivaji procession in Bagalkot

title: Free housing pattas distributed to 3.09 lakh beneficiaries of Adi Dravidar and tribal communities
content: About 1,000 housing units with 90% subsidy have been given to conservancy workers. The free meals programme has benefitted 1.29¬†lakh¬†conservancy workers in urban local bodies, says the Adi¬†Dravidar¬†and Tribal Welfare Department

title: Mandya gears up to tackle summer thirst; ZP CEO warns officials
content: No village to face water shortage this summer, says Ms K R Nandini; Village-wise plan ready to ensure uninterrupted water supply in the district

title: Job fairs being held in every district to help unemployed: Santosh Lad
content: The Minister says that the State government has been working to create employment opportunities for aspiring youth

title: Bengaluru North Corporation notifies 70 stray dog feeding spots
content: ‚ÄòSteps have been taken to ensure humane management of street dogs while balancing public health and environmental cleanliness‚Äô

title: ‚ÄòNirbhaya Nisha‚Äô to boost women‚Äôs safety: Pinarayi
content: Chief Minister says project designed by Kerala Police is a model step to ensure women‚Äôs safety. It will serve to instil a sense of safety among women who travel at odd hours for work and other essential needs

title: UN launches road safety financing project in four States
content: UN Road Safety Fund-backed initiative in Rajasthan, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Assam targets 50% reduction in road traffic deaths by 2030

title: India set to launch free nationwide HPV vaccination for adolescent girls
content: India will use Gardasil, a quadrivalent HPV vaccine, for protection from HPV types 16 and 18, which cause cervical cancer, as well as types 6 and 11

title: 19,133 graduates receive degrees at Gulbarga University convocation
content: Governor and Chancellor Thaawar Chand Gehlot presents honorary degrees to three distinguished personalities

title: Drugged & assaulted: How 2 sisters ran a rape-conversion racket in Bhopal
content: Police have registered two FIRs for rape and forced religious conversion against a gang in Bhopal. Two women, one from Chhattisgarh and another from Bhopal, were allegedly lured with job offers, then sexually exploited and pressured to convert. Three individuals, including the alleged mastermind Razia, have been arrested as investigations continue.

title: After Amma: AIADMK's struggle to fill the void left by Jayalalithaa
content: Nearly a decade after J Jayalalithaa's death, the AIADMK struggles to regain its dominance, battling leadership disputes and electoral defeats. As Tamil Nadu heads to the 2026 assembly polls, the party, now led by Edappadi Palaniswami, seeks to overcome the void left by 'Amma' and forge alliances to challenge the ruling DMK.

title: Sam Altman issues blunt warning at IIT-Delhi, says: You should not trust me for ...
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman advised young Indians against solely relying on traditional career advice, emphasizing the need to develop and trust their own intuition in the rapidly changing AI era. He acknowledged that while some jobs will disappear, new ones will emerge, and encouraged risk-taking, stating his own willingness to fail has led to success.

title: ‚ÄòRoot out enemies and traitors‚Äô: Sasikala floats new political party ahead of Tamil Nadu elections
content: Expelled AIADMK leader VK Sasikala has announced the formation of a new political party in Tamil Nadu, vowing to champion the cause of the poor and downtrodden. Unveiling a flag featuring prominent Dravidian leaders, she stated the party would follow their ideology. Sasikala also recalled being urged to become Chief Minister after Jayalalithaa's demise.

title: IBM‚Äôs rout, 'ghost' GDP: Why AI doom loop may be just a 'scary bedtime story'
content: Markets were rattled after a report projected a 2028 worldwide intelligence crisis, claiming AI would decimate professional roles and spark economic freefall, leading to a steep drop in IBM‚Äôs share price. Yet many specialists dispute this doomsday timeline, arguing that AI‚Äôs impact will unfold more gradually, with outcomes depending significantly on how policymakers manage labor, regulation, and innovation.

title: Court documents show FB Messenger‚Äôs feature that a Meta executive warned about
content: New court documents reveal Meta executives warned that encrypting Facebook Messenger was irresponsible. They feared a major drop in detecting child exploitation and terrorism material.  Internal chats show top safety officials expressed concerns about hiding content from moderation systems.  Meta stated these concerns led to developing new safety features before encryption launched.

title: Hilarious Babar Azam memes take over internet after another flop show in T20 World Cup
content: Babar Azam‚Äôs poor T20 World Cup form continued with a slow 25 off 24 against England, sparking memes online. Pakistan made 164/9, with Sahibzada Farhan scoring 63. England bowlers kept things tight. Coach Mike Hesson said Babar was picked for stability in the middle order, not powerplay hitting, but fans still mocked his struggles in the tournament.

title: Rinku Singh rushes back home due to medical emergency in family
content: India batter Rinku Singh has returned home due to a family medical emergency, as his father‚Äôs health has worsened during cancer treatment. He missed India‚Äôs training session in Chennai and there is no clarity on when he will rejoin the squad, which may force team management to consider replacements. The rest of the Indian team trained as usual ahead of their T20 World Cup matches.

title: IBM stock‚Äôs worst single-day drop in 25 yrs over Anthropic tool
content: IBM shares plummeted after AI startup Anthropic announced its tool can automate COBOL modernization, threatening IBM's core mainframe business. This AI advancement could compress years-long, costly migration projects into months, impacting recurring revenue from hardware, software, and services. The market reacted swiftly, signaling a potential shift in the legacy IT services landscape.

title: After Keralam, Bangla? Mamata renews demand for name change; attacks BJP
content: The Union Cabinet approved Kerala's name change to Keralam. This sparked a political row. West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee questioned why her state's proposal to be renamed Bangla is pending. She accused the Centre of discrimination. The Centre's decision comes ahead of assembly elections in both states.

title: 'I am not supportive of that': Gukesh slams Kramnik over cheating claims
content: World champion D Gukesh criticised Vladimir Kramnik‚Äôs cheating allegations, saying cheating has been made a bigger issue than it is. While firmly against unethical play, Gukesh said he does not support Kramnik‚Äôs approach and called for harmony in chess. The 19-year-old spoke ahead of the Prague International Chess Festival, where he hopes to regain form.

title: 'We're 2002': Nitish Kumar's big slip as he loses cool on oppn in assembly - watch
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar lost his composure in the assembly amidst opposition protests alleging rule by "guns and bullets." He mistakenly stated the NDA's strength as "two thousand and two" instead of 202. The protest began over a police baton charge on village chowkidars demanding higher stipends.

title: Iran ups the ante: Tehran finalising deal to buy Chinese anti-ship cruise missiles
content: Iran is reportedly close to finalizing a deal with China for advanced CM-302 supersonic anti-ship missiles, a move that could significantly bolster its naval defense capabilities. The potential transfer comes amid heightened US naval presence and escalating tensions in the region, potentially complicating American efforts to curb Iran's military programs.

title: Toilet trouble: US troops feel the 'pressure' as Trump vows to flush out Khamenei regime
content: America's most advanced aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald R Ford, is grappling with persistent sewage system failures during its extended deployment near the Middle East. Despite the Navy's assurances of operational readiness, the $13 billion vessel's next-generation plumbing struggles with waste from its 4,600-strong crew, leading to frequent clogs and demanding 19-hour shifts for engineers.

title: Mayank Pawar's Death: Splitsvilla 7 star dies at 37 in Mumbai; prayer meet on Feb 25
content: Splitsvilla 7 fame Mayank Pawar has passed away in Mumbai at the age of 37. The reality star and bodybuilding champion's sudden death has deeply shocked fans and the fitness industry. The exact cause of his passing remains unconfirmed, with a prayer meeting scheduled for February 25, 2026.

title: 'Should play Kohli's role': India batter asked to 'become a chase master'
content: Mohammed Kaif advised Tilak Varma to ignore criticism and stick to his natural anchor role in the T20 World Cup 2026. Tilak struggled with form and failed when he tried to play aggressively against South Africa. Kaif said Tilak should play like Virat Kohli and focus on batting deep, since India already has many attacking players. Tilak is expected to play in India‚Äôs key match against Zimbabwe.

title: 'Scrap US trade deal': Rahul dares PM Modi; repeats 'sold India' claim
content: Rahul Gandhi claimed Union minister Hardeep Puri's name in the infamous Epstein files was released to "threaten" the PM, and that there are "videos and messages which have not been released from the millions of Epstein files" held up in the US. In another allegation, Rahul claimed that the case against Adani in the United States is not against the industrialist but against PM Modi.‚Äã‚Äã

title: Major blow for India! Captain skips fielding after injury, doubt over next match
content: India suffered a setback in the first ODI against Australia as captain Harmanpreet Kaur injured her knee while batting and did not field, with Smriti Mandhana leading instead. Harmanpreet scored 53, while Mandhana made 58, but India were restricted to 214. Australia chased it easily, winning by six wickets to lead 1-0. Beth Mooney starred with 76 as India now await Harmanpreet‚Äôs fitness update.

title: Kerala now Keralam: Centre gives nod for name change; Tharoor quips, ‚ÄòKeralamite, Keralamian‚Äô?
content: The Union Cabinet has approved renaming Kerala to 'Keralam', following a state assembly resolution. This move, aimed at reflecting the name in Malayalam, has sparked a linguistic debate. Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor humorously questioned the new terms for residents, asking how people from the state now would be referred to, and what happens to terms like ‚ÄúKeralite and Keralan‚Äù.

title: Watch: Zelenskyy reveals his 'base' in Kyiv; taunts Putin - watch
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy revealed the Kyiv bunker where he directed the nation's initial war response, recalling US President Biden's offer to evacuate him. He famously replied, 'I need ammunition, not a ride.

title: 'Good news will come': Sasikala hints at new political party ahead of Tamil Nadu polls
content: Former AIADMK leader VK Sasikala has hinted at launching a new political party, making the announcement during an event commemorating former chief minister Jayalalithaa's birth anniversary. She said, "Good news will come". This potential move could introduce a three-way contest in the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, alongside the existing DMK and BJP-AIADMK alliances.

title: PM Modi meets Manipur CM, his two deputies in New Delhi
content: BJP's Yumnam Khemchand Singh was sworn in as CM of Manipur on February 4, reinstating the NDA government along with Kuki legislator Nemcha Kipgen and Naga MLA Losii Dikho as his deputies, marking a fresh spin on shared governance in a multi-ethnic state riven by the Meitei-Kuki conflict. Governor AK Bhalla also administered the oath of office to BJP's Konthoujam Govindas and Khuraijam Loken Singh of NPP as cabinet ministers at the Lok Bhavan ceremony.

title: UPSC extends CSE 2026 deadline after portal issues ‚Äî check application dates & details
content: The Union Public Service Commission has extended the application deadline for Civil Services Examination 2026 and Indian Forest Service Examination 2026 until February 27, 2026, 6 pm, after technical issues affected the online portal due to heavy traffic. The recruitment will fill 933 vacancies through Preliminary, Main and interview stages. Eligibility requires a bachelor‚Äôs degree and age between 21 and 32 years. Serving IAS, IPS and IFS officers cannot reapply unless they resign.

title: 5 Pakistani cops killed in coordinated militant attack in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
content: No group immediately claimed responsibility for the assault, which appeared to be carefully timed to target responding officers. The violence came just a day after another deadly episode in nearby Karak. On Monday, attackers used an explosives-laden drone to hit a paramilitary post, injuring several personnel. As the wounded were being transported for treatment, the assailants ambushed two ambulances.

title: Saudi Arabia opens domestic Hajj 2026 registration: Eligibility, dates & steps you need to know
content: Saudi Arabia has opened Hajj 1447 AH (2026) registration for citizens and residents inside the Kingdom via the Nusuk platform. Priority is given to first-time pilgrims, with package bookings commencing soon. Applicants must meet age and health requirements, with residents needing a valid permit of over one year.

title: Iran's war calculus: Why Khamenei is betting on Trump for his regime's survival
content: The United States has built up one of its largest Middle East deployments in years, with two aircraft carriers moving into position and additional warships and aircraft arriving in the region. The State Department has also begun thinning out exposed outposts. Meanwhile, Iran is preparing itself for a protracted war with US. It is dispersing authority, hardening infrastructure, rehearsing retaliation, tightening internal security, and signaling that it can raise global costs through Hormuz and regional targeting.

title: NRR drama peaks: How Team India can still reach T20 World Cup semis
content: India's T20 World Cup 2026 semifinal path is challenging. A significant loss to South Africa has impacted their net run rate. India must win their upcoming matches convincingly. Dominant victories are crucial to improve their net run rate and secure a spot in the semifinals. The team faces Zimbabwe and West Indies next.

title: Stock market crash: Sensex plunges 1,000 points - top reasons for fall
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex tanked in trade on Tuesday on weak global cues and IT stocks rout along with fresh tariff threats from US President Donald Trump. While Nifty50 dropped over 300 points, BSE Sensex went below the 82,000 intraday.

title: J'khand plane crash: Family took loan to book aircraft; to save 1, 7 died in tragedy
content: An air ambulance carrying a burn victim, his wife, and nephew crashed in Chatra, killing all seven on board. The family had taken a loan and used savings for the costly evacuation to Delhi for advanced treatment after a hotel fire.

title: ‚ÄòIn touch with Hafiz Saeed‚Äô: How LeT's Shabir Ahmed is linked to 8 held for plotting terror attack
content: Delhi Police has busted a Bangladesh terror module run by Shabir Ahmed Lone, who was in direct contact with LeT commander Hafeez Saeed. Lone, a Kashmiri resident, was released on bail in 2019 and fled to Bangladesh. He was tasked with recruiting and radicalizing illegal Bangladeshi migrants in India, arranging fake IDs and weapons for potential attacks.

title: Want to meet Punch? The viral baby monkey with plushie from Japan has finally found friends
content: A seven-month-old Japanese macaque, Punch, rejected by his mother and bullied by peers, found solace in a plush toy named 'Ora-mama'. This heartwarming story of resilience and connection went viral globally, drawing immense sympathy and support. Recent updates reveal Punch has now made new friends at the zoo, signifying his growing acceptance within his social group.

title: 'Dear Mumma..I am sorry....they killed me': Four years after her son's death, mother awaits justice
content: Arti Malhotra's son Arvey died by suicide On February 24, 2022 after enduring severe school bullying.  Four years later, Arti continues her fight for justice. She advocates for anti-bullying laws and accountability from the school.  Despite ongoing efforts, the legal process faces delays.  Arti's activism highlights the immense pain of a mother seeking closure and justice for her child.

title: 'Rioting charges added to FIR': Delhi Police on Youth Congress 'shirtless' protest
content: Delhi Police has added rioting charges to the FIR against Indian Youth Congress members. The group staged a shirtless protest at the AI Impact Summit last week. Police stated the protesters attempted to breach security and injured personnel. Eight individuals, including IYC chief Uday Bhanu Chib, have been arrested.

title: 'Wounded yet in high spirits': Army shares update on dog Tyson who 'took the first bullet'
content: Army dog Tyson, a German Shepherd, bravely took a bullet to the leg while leading troops into a terrorist hideout during Operation Trashi-I in Kishtwar. His courageous actions helped neutralize three Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists. Wounded but spirited, Tyson is recovering well, embodying unwavering devotion to duty and serving as a true warrior.

title: Iran: Military chopper crashes into market; 4 dead
content: A military helicopter crashed into a bustling market in central Iran, claiming at least four lives, including the pilot and co-pilot. The aircraft was reportedly on a training mission when it fell in Dorcheh, Isfahan province. This incident follows another recent aviation fatality, highlighting Iran's ongoing challenges with its aging air fleet.

title: Stones, Abuses, Then Dog Drew First Blood: How Jaish Terrorist Saifullah Was Killed In J&K
content: Saifullah -- the most wanted Jaish commander from Pakistan -- who had been evading security forces for months, was finally tracked down through drone surveillance.

title: Drunk Driver Goes On Rampage In Tamil Nadu, Rams Shops, Vehicles
content: A man, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, drove his car recklessly outside a bus terminus in Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram district on Monday.

title: Lover's Blackmail, Daughter's Wedding: The Case Of Surat Builder's Suicide
content: The death of Tushar Ghelani, a prominent builder in Surat, has sent shockwaves through the city. In a breakthrough, the Umra police have arrested his partner, Poonam Bhadoria, on charges of abetting his suicide.

title: Tata Sons Board Defers Decision On N Chandrasekaran's 3rd Term: Report
content: The board of Tata Sons on Tuesday deferred a decision on the re-appointment of Natarajan Chandrasekaran for a third term as Chairman.

title: Shashi Tharoor's "Linguistic Question" As Centre Okays Kerala Name Change
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor had a witty take on Kerala's name change on Tuesday, asking what happens now to the terms "Keralite" and "Keralan" for the "denizens" of the new "Keralam".

title: Children Found Crying Next To Mother's Body At Bihar Railway Station
content: The discovery of a woman's body on a bench at the Madhepura railway station in Bihar caused an uproar on Tuesday morning. In a harrowing scene, the woman's two young children were found sitting on either side of her lifeless body, weeping.

title: 'Accused On The Run, Will Be Arrested': Arunachal Chief Minister On Racist Attack On 3 Women In Delhi
content: A man and a woman who hurled racist abuse on three women from Arunachal Pradesh on camera are allegedly on the run, according to the chief minister of the border state in the northeast region.

title: Australian PM Anthony Albanese Evacuated From Residence After Bomb Threat
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was evacuated from his official residence over a bomb threat on Tuesday. He was taken to a separate location for several hours.

title: Iran Faces US Wrath, But 5,000 Sailors On USS Ford Face 650 Failing Toilets
content: The USS Gerald R. Ford has been at sea since June last year. The Republican leader's decision to extend its deployment for a second time has snowballed into a growing list of problems, such as blocked toilets and sewage troubles.

title: Opinion: Opinion | West Bengal Polls: Why Both Trinamool And BJP Want To Woo The Rajbanshis
content: The BJP's march in Bengal has been primarily powered by the Rajbanshi and Matua communities, spread across the northern and eastern border regions, respectively.

title: Class 10 Student Killed In Karnataka Assault, 2 Minors Detained
content: A Class 10 student was killed after being assaulted in Uragadur on the outskirts of Shivamogga city in Karnataka, leading to tension in the area.

title: Will AI Replace Software Engineers? What Anthropic CEO Said
content: As the world comes to grips with the gargantuan growth of artificial intelligence and the threat it poses to the job market, Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has some career advice for young professionals.

title: Zelensky Reveals The Bunker From Where He Led Response To Russian Invasion
content: Walking through a warren of tunnels under central Kyiv, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said it was from this secure compound that he started marshalling Ukraine's response to Russia's invasion on February 24, 2022.

title: Anthropic Co-Founder Dario Amodei Explains Why He Left Sam Altman's OpenAI
content: Differences over the vision and approach to artificial intelligence: those were the primary reasons Dario Amodei, co-founder of AI firm Anthropic, left OpenAI.

title: Markets Crash 1,000 Points Amid Rising US-Iran Tensions, Trade Uncertainties
content: The Indian stock markets saw a massive crash today amid rising geopolitical tensions between the US and Iran, concerns over artificial intelligence-led disruption, and trade-related uncertainties.

title: "Was Starting To Despair": Why Anthropic CEO Shifted From Biology To AI

title: Opinion: Opinion | If You Don't Care About Taj Mahal's Architect, Why Cry Over Lutyens?
content: The parallel, if one has to be drawn, is not with Shah Jahan and the Taj. It is with the architect of the Taj, and most of us don't know his name either. Why, then, should we bother too much with a British architect?

title: Punjab's Rs 40-Crore Border Plan After Targeted Cop Killings
content: Two Punjab police personnel were found shot dead at a checkpost in Gurdaspur near the Indo-Pak border on Sunday, raising serious concerns about the security situation in the state.

title: What Lack Of A Leader Of Opposition Means For Maharashtra's Democracy
content: In a development unprecedented in the political history of the state, the Maharashtra Budget Session 2026 commenced on February 23 without a recognised Leader of Opposition in either the Legislative Assembly or the Legislative Council.

title: What's Anthropic's Plan In India? CEO Dario Amodei Shows A Preview
content: Anthropic wants to embed itself inside India's powerful IT and consulting ecosystem, CEO Dario Amodei has said.

title: Olympic standouts, disappointments from all 32 NHL teams
content: the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament ended in thrilling fashion . both teams were comprised of players -- many of them superstars . all but one of the countries had at least one active NHL player on the roster . it's time to assess which players will be coming home content with how they performed .

title: Way-too-early preview for the 2030 Olympics
content: the 2030 Olympics will be spread across the country on sunday . the ice seemed tilted very much in the american's favor for the first time . it's clear Team USA is building a potential dynasty . if you paid attention in the lead-up and during the Games, it is clear team USA could have some growing pain .

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: No one loves late drama like Liverpool. What's behind their taste for theatrics?
content: arsenal beat Nottingham Forest 1-0 in the premier league on sunday afternoon . the win is the latest dramatic installment in a campaign characterized by last-gasp winners . it is a quirk that has inflicted both joy and misery on head coach arne slot's side .

title: MMA divisional rankings: Heavyweight top 10 is light on changes or impact
content: the heavyweight division is seriously lacking in depth and activity at the top . the fight ended prematurely as a no-contest after he suffered eye pokes that required surgery and threaten to end his career . it's not going to stay in a valley forever, but MMA fans will await that day eagerly .

title: Hooked on hockey after the Olympics? An updated look at the NHL's playoff picture
content: the NHL paused its season to allow its players to compete in the 2026 winter Olympics in Italy . around 143 players saw action in the Olympic men's hockey tournament . most players didn't participate, getting a multiweek break from the action .

title: Kings of the hot corner: Buster Olney ranks baseball's best third basemen
content: we rank the best of the best at third base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career.
